content.title: Mukhyamantri Amrutum Yojana Scheme
content.details: A large number of households are pushed into poverty as a result of the high costs of household spending on health care. The Below Poverty Line (BPL) population is especially vulnerable to catastrophic health risks. To address this key vulnerability faced by the BPL population in Gujarat, the State Government has launched a medical care scheme called Mukhyamantri Amrutum (MA) Yojana. The objective of the scheme is to improve access of BPL families to quality medical and surgical care for the treatment of identified diseases involving hospitalization, surgeries and therapies through an em panel network of health care providers.
benefits: Poly Trauma (Not covered by Motor Vehicle Insurance) (a total 8 Benefit Packages)
Cancer (Malignancies) (Surgical Oncology, Chemotherapy & Radiation Oncology) (a total 210 Benefit Packages)
eligibility: Individuals and families listed in the BPL list by the State Government are eligible under the MA Yojana.
Each family member should be present when enrolled under the scheme.

Families that belong marginally above the poverty line can be under the MA Vatsalya Yojana if they follow these criteria: annual income of the family is up to ₹4 Lakhs, any member(s) who are Accredited Social Health Activist (ASHA) workers, any member(s) who have accredited reporters, Class-3 and Class-4 employees employed on a fixed payroll by the State Government, Senior Citizens with families of a total annual income of up to ₹6 Lakhs.
content.application_process: Offline. The eligible beneficiaries must visit the Kiosks at Taluka or Civic Centres in their area. Mobile kiosks are also available at a local level. The authorities are well equipped with the needed hardware for enrolment. The hardware is used to capture biometrics such as fingerprints, iris scans, and photos of the beneficiaries. The beneficiaries might even have to fill out the MA Card application form in Gujarati with appropriate details. Once the details are verified, the MA health card is issued to the beneficiaries and the enrolment process is complete.
documents_required: Certificate saying that your family qualifies for the below-the-poverty line

faqs.question: How many members of a family are covered under this scheme?
faqs.answer: A maximum of 5 members can be enrolled as per the regulations. However, a newborn child can be considered as the 6th member.

faqs.question: Who is eligible under the MA Yojana scheme?
faqs.answer: The annual income of the family is up to ₹4 Lakhs, any member(s) who are Accredited Social Health Activist (ASHA) workers, any member(s) who have accredited reporters, Class-3 and Class-4 employees employed on a fixed payroll by the State Government, Senior Citizens with families of a total annual income of up to ₹6 Lakhs.

faqs.question: What documents do the beneficiaries need to provide at the time of enrolment?
faqs.answer: The eligible beneficiaries have to submit the following documents - Address proof, Identity proof, BPL certificate, Income certificate.

faqs.question: How much coverage does the MA Yojana scheme provide?
faqs.answer: The scheme provides tertiary medical coverage of up to ₹5 lakh to each eligible family. Besides, ₹300 is paid to the beneficiary for transportation to the empanelled hospital.

faqs.question: Which Surgeries Covered in this Scheme?
faqs.answer: Cardiovascular Surgeries (a total 153 Benefit Packages), Neurosurgery (a total 49 Benefit Packages), Burns (a total 12 Benefit Packages), Poly Trauma (Not covered by Motor Vehicle Insurance) (a total 8 Benefit Packages), Cancer (Malignancies) (Surgical Oncology, Chemotherapy & Radiation Oncology) (a total 210 Benefit Packages), Renal (Kidney) (a total 21 Benefit Packages), Neonatal (newborn) diseases (a total 23 Benefit Packages).

The authorities are well equipped with the needed hardware for enrolment. The hardware is used to capture biometrics such as fingerprints, iris scans, and photos of the beneficiaries.
